dublinCore.dc:title: 119 S757 IS: Tribal Adoption Parity Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Ms. Klobuchar (for herself and Mr. Hoeven) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance

form.official-title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to recognize Indian tribal governments for purposes of determining under the adoption credit whether a child has special needs.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Tribal Adoption Parity Act.

section.header: Recognizing Indian tribal governments for purposes of determining under the adoption credit whether a child has special needs

subsection.text: Paragraph (3) of section 23(d) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amendedâ€”

paragraph.text: in subparagraph (A), by inserting or Indian tribal government after the words a State, and
in subparagraph (B), by inserting or Indian tribal government after the words such State.

subsection.text: The amendments made by subsection (a) shall apply to taxable years beginning after the date of the enactment of this Act.
